title: Sylas - Pros and Cons
body:
Back for a few minutes to basically outline the things I like about Sylas, and the things I really don't like about him.  It helps that Reddit is weird at this time of night, and I can't sleep.
--------------------------------------------
**Sylas - The Vintage Player's Dream**

Pro: 
Why do I call him that? Because we have a lot of experience with all of the ultimates. We've tinkered around with, played with, and abused ultimates from the original 40 until now.  Myself, even on this account, I'm at least Mastery 4 with every champion on the roster.

God it will be fun with a cherry picking of ults every game.

Con: 
He adds damage onto a lot of ults that shouldn't really HAVE damage.  At least when those champions are played how they are meant to be.  Their scaling is intense for precisely this reason, and Sylas is simply designed to abuse the holy hell out of this.


**Sylas - Yet Another AOE Burster**

Pro:
Wave clear is going to be easy, and his farm is very likely to be intense every game.  Split pushing will be masterful, with ease.

Con: 
Yeah, just what the game needed.  More AOE burst.


**Sylas - The Jack Of All Trades**

Pro:
With his ability to snag ults, namely those that make you tougher, he will be able to gap fill pretty much anything his team needs simply by jacking the ultimate from specific champions.  Need a tanky champ? Steal from Jax or Cho.  Need more damage? Steal Zed's.

Con:
This will make him either a solid ban, or a solid pick, in every single game until he's nerfed into oblivion.  The last thing players want is a functional 5v6 mechanics wise.
------------------------------
All in all he seems like he is a fun concept, but he's right down the same path RIOT has mindlessly carved for the past few years. He is a champion who can 'do it all' while still killing your team.

But the biggest Pro of all? Imma Veigar ult a Veigar.

replies.body:
You're doing this wrong:
Pro:
Con: Sylas

You can not really make a reliable list in such a short time period. He was released 3 days ago on the PBE. Riot themselves with their mass and reliabilty of information need weeks to assess where he stands balancewise. 
At this point no one knows how to play this champ. No one knows his weakness, strenghts, how to play with or against him. People are trying him out and still explore what he is capable of doing.

> [{quoted}](name=Real Lyze,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eoLTKxh2,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-01-11T14:48:43.580+0000)

It's not really about learning what he can do when we already know his core concept is EXTREMELY flawed. Giving one champion access to over 140 abilities is going to make for ridiculously high inconsistency, which is going to be a balancing nightmare. To make up for this he needs to be either very self sufficient without his ultimate counting for the times whatever ultimates he steals will be trash, OR he has to be nerfed into the ground accounting for the three or four ultimates he can use which synergize with his kit way too well. There really can't ever be a middle ground with a champion like this, he either has to be banned every game or made unplayable.

> [{quoted}](name=CapnMorganFr3man,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eoLTKxh2,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-01-11T15:11:29.266+0000)

To make up for this he needs to be either very self sufficient without his ultimate counting for the times whatever ultimates he steals will be trash, OR he has to be nerfed into the ground accounting for the three or four ultimates he can use which synergize with his kit way too well. There really can't ever be a middle ground with a champion like this, he either has to be banned every game or made unplayable.

Thing is, if the enemy has a Sylas you can make him as strong or weak as you like. Enemy team firstpicks Sylas? Don't pick Malphite or Sejuani or some other champion with a very powerful R into him. Pick Udyr or Corki or something and he's a piece of cake. The match starts at champ select, not when you spawn at your fountain. Sylas, more than most champions, takes macro- strategy to play against instead of TROLOLOL 1 MILLION DASHES OUTPLAYZ. I thought that most people around here wanted more of that in the game?

This is very true.

The only problem I see is that the champion pool is so dwindled that he will always have something useful to snag.
Yeah I'm not gonna pick a champ I don't play like Jayce in ranked in an attempt to gimp the Sylas, I'll just end up feeding.

> It's not really about learning

Since the OP made a thread about is strengths and weaknesses it is indeed about learning.

That inconsistency is his niche. Not every ult is useful to copy and thats part of what will make him not be broken. 
He is supposed to be a counter pick, a champ that you pick if the enemy team fits your needs or has useful ults. So probably the right way to balance him is to imagine him being picked against a to him good but not perfect enemy team comp. Riot gives champs a budget. So if they give his ult an average value of 3/10 they give the rest of his kit 7/10. His kit should be bad without good ults but also not too good or opressive with some good ults. He should excel against teams with only strong ults.

Well, champions like Udyr and Corki are gonna have a field day with him. I wonder how stealing Jayce, Elise and Nidalee ult works... does he get all their abilities? If not those ults are completely useless to him. Anyway, I'm looking forward to using Tryndamere's trick on myself and make him ragequit for a change.
Unironiclly Corki's ult is great on him. and for transformation champs he gets their whole transformation.

One thing that really bothers me about Sylas (apart from his ultimate) is his W - Kingslayer.  The damage portion is an execute while the heal portion against champions is somewhat of a get out of jail free card.  This ability will feel like crap to play against.  

Irelia's old E (the one where if she had a higher % max health than you, she'd slow you, and stun otherwise) was admitted by Riot to be horrible gameplay design which punished you if you were trading well against Ireli.  IMO, Kingslayer is very similar, and later in the game it promotes the "counter play" of having to burst Sylas down instantly or he will get a maximum of a 500 + 80% AP health heal when fighting you.

I wouldn't be so damn worried about him being the next unfixable kalista / Camille / Akali / irelia, if his base kit wasn't so **ridiculously overloaded**.

Stealing ults is probably the strongest ability in the game, and thus a lot of sylas power budget should be allocated there.

Curiously enough, Sylas kit is seemingly designed to be self sufficient even without an ultimate. All his abilities are very strong, to the point I would expect some kind of "enabling" ultimate next to it (like Jax, Riven, Aatrox etc), and not such a powerful tool.

I mean, sometimes he'll be fighting an enemy Sylas, or an Udyr, and he'll effectively have no ult, so he'll need a strong base kit.

And then two minutes later he'll have a Karthus ult.

But he won't have a Karthus ult at all in the next game.

And then he'll bust out an Ez ult.

And then his damage will drop as he stands around with a Mundo ult.

Sylas's ult might as well be called "Gamble." Or maybe "Clown Fiesta" would better convey the intended theme. Or "Husbando, So Who Cares."

There's 5 champs. He won't be 1v1ing an Udyr all game, and his kit is massively overloaded, especially with that ultimate. And if the enemy team tries to gimp him by picking useless ult champs, then they're really just gimping themselves, and the ults themselves still have at least some use.

When he steals Karma or something like hers, he gets her whole damn kit, which he can drop at will and get his own. Because balance.
It's not really pros and cons is it? More like what's overpowered and what's broken.

> God it will be fun with a cherry picking of ults every game.

The playmaking potential with Sylas R is huge.

Imagine late game, you're in a game deciding teamfight and you steal the enemy Malphite, Amumu or Soraka's ultimate.


Good use of that ability can win you a lot of games.

 

Good usage of Hijack will be the difference between a good Sylas player and a great Sylas player.

Basically Pro points are that he is going to be the top ace pick if you aren't a master at something specific

And con's are that he exists.

Based on what you said because 2 out of your 3 cons are complaints about his design in itself.

Given that ultimates are supposed to be game changing skills, it seems weird to have a champion that can steal ultimates and just spam the heck out of them.  This champion needs to be taken back to the workshop (perhaps along with most of the other champs released this past season).
